info.value: Have you ever heard about the Polar Bear Club in New York? These “Polar Bears” are people who meet frequently in winter to swim in freezing cold water. However, doctors do not agree about the medical effects of cold-water swimming. Some are worried about the dangers of a condition in which the body’s temperature drops so low that finally the heart stops. Other doctors, however, point out that there is more danger of a heart attack during summer swimming, because the difference between the air temperature and water temperature is much greater in summer than in winter.
